result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Robert Hornbeak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.

Must follow all rules of Probation. Must report to Probation today (12/2/2016).
Concurrent with: 15CF34 & 15CF236

miscConds.notes:
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elective office until civil rights are restored. No contact with Antonio Neuman.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation Agent if necessary. Subject to work release. Not subject to good time.
